entry.title: Ok….here’s the instructions on how to install the ...
entry.content:
Ok….here’s the instructions on how to install the skin on the HTC PPC 6800. (Some of them were changed a bit, but overall, they are pretty much the same as the ones above). Please follow each step, making sure that you do everything on each step before moving to the next.
Now, I used most of the default programs included in the Windows Mobile 6 Version. For example: I did not use the gCalc, PHM Registry editor, Textman, gmail, or the Opera Mini 4 Beta browser. For the calculator, mail, text messaging, and web browser, I used the ones provided in the windows mobile 6. However, you may use and install gCalc, Textman, gmail, or Opera; just follow the instructions provided by Jenny for each program you want to use.

Step 1 - Make sure that you have synced your phone and that you have backed up any important files using Active Sync. The program should have been inside the box when you purchased the phone. If not, download it from here: https://www.microsoft.com/windowsmobile/downloads/eula_activesync45_1033.mspx?ProductID=76
Install Active Sync (if you haven’t already), hook up your phone to your PC using the appropriate USB cable connections, and follow the on screen instructions. Once you have backed up your phone, unplug it and perform a soft reset.

** With Active Sync, you will be able to explore your phone contents through the sync connection. (By going into – Start\My Computer\Mobile Device) **


Step 2 - Using your computer, download the zip file of the skin and the programs used provided by the wonderful Jenny, and save it in a folder into your computer. The link is - http://www.divshare.com/download/1233462-03a - or can be found above (top of page) -Download the “skin1.4zip”- Extract the file into your computer.

Also, using your computer Download the Contact Manager program.
• Download Contact Manager (Pocket CM) from the link: http://www.pocketcm.com/downloadfile.php?f=PocketCM-0.15.cab
Download the .cab file from the link above. (Click on the word “Link” from the phrase – “your download will start soon, if it doesn’t please use this link.”
a) Save it somewhere in your computer.
b) Drag the .cab file into your phone using Active Sync.
Using your phone, download and install:
• Google Maps by visiting the page www.google.com/gmm from your mobile phone web browser.
o Use your built in web browser (Internet Explorer) to navigate to: www.google.com/gmm
o Select "Download Google Maps"
o Select "Open File after Download"
o Install the program into your device.
Step 3 - Now, plug in your phone through USB cable (if you haven’t already). This way you will be able to explore your phone contents through the sync connection. (By going into – Start\My Computer\Mobile Device)

Then, you need to download and install the Slide2Unlock .cab file from this link using your computer - http://www.student.ru.nl/s.m.andishmand/Slide2UnLock1_21WM5.cab - (or you can use the one provided in the zip file from above). Save the .cab file into your computer and then transfer the file into your phone using active sync.
(You can configure Slide2Unlock by following the instructions on the “readme” file provided after you install the program which should be located In the Program directory of your phone.)


Step 4 - Install the following programs – these programs can be found in the zip file you downloaded earlier (from step 2)…
…Remember that some of them are optional and that I am only providing instructions for the ones I used. Instructions for the other programs are available on top of this page…

1) Install PHM Registry. (Optional)
2) Install TextMan. (Optional)
3) Install gCalc. (Optional)
4) Install Weather Watch Mobile
a) The cab is located in: skin1.4\Programs\WWM105.cab
b) Drag the Cab into the "My Documents" folder on your phone using sync software
c) Navigate to the cab on your phone and install it onto your phone by clicking on it
5) Install Youtube - The files are located in: skin1.4\Programs\Youtube
WM5 Users:
a) Copy contents of the Step 1 folder into your \Windows directory of your phone.
b) Copy Step#2- Streaming_210.cab to your device and install to main memory
c) Soft-reset
d) Copy Step #3-HTC_Streaming_Media.cab to your device and install to main memory
WM6 Users:
e) Copy Step #3-HTC_Streaming_Media.cab to your device and install to main memory
f) Do a soft reset
6)
7) Install TCPMP (Music Program)
a) The cab is located in: skin1.4\Programs\tcpmp.cab
b) Drag the Cab into the "My Documents" folder on your phone using sync software
c) Navigate to the cab on your phone and install it onto your phone by clicking on it
8) Soft Reset your device…….
Now you are ready to install the skin.
Installing the Skin…(These are pretty much the same instructions as the ones provided above.)
1. Today:
1. Start by removing everything from your home screen:
1. Settings>Today
2. Remove everything from your Today Screen
2. Next copy the skin from: skin1.4\TodayTheme\black.tsk to your My Documents folder on your phone.
3. Go to Settings>Personal>Today and apply the theme.
2. RL Today
1. The cab is located in: skin1.4\Skin\rlToday\rlToday.cab
2. Drag the Cab into the "My Documents" folder on your phone using sync software
3. Navigate to the cab on your phone and install it onto your phone by clicking on it
4. Now take the iPhone file and put it in the rlToday file
under Programs.
5. rlToday should now be on the home screen. Click and hold on the home screen until an "Option" button appears. Click on it.
6. Select iPhone as your skin and then set up all your programs under the Applications tab, using the pictures in the iPhone folder for the icons located (in your phone) under – Program Files\rlToday\iPhone.
Delete any programs located in the small window. Each time you will click “add” for each program below, in the exact same order. When you click “add”, 4 options will appear:
• Name: The program Name (ex. SMS, Photos, Camera, etc.)
• File Path: This is where the program .exe is located in your phone- most of these will be located in the windows directory of your phone. I use the shortcuts located in Windows\StartMenu\Programs
• Command line: You will only need this for Youtube to tell the web browser (Internet Explorer) to go to that web site.
• Custom Icon: This is the .png icon that will show on the home screen of your phone. These are located in your phone in this directory - Program Files\rlToday\iPhone.

Now, start adding the programs…
 SMS: blank.png, Windows\Start menu\programs\messaging.lnk
 Photos: rl_photo.png, \Windows\Start menu\pictures & video.lnk
 Camera: rl_cam.png, \ Windows\Start menu\programs\camera.lnk
 Youtube: rl_youtube.png, \ Windows\Start menu\programs\internet explorer.lnk, Command Line: m.youtube.com
 Finder: rl_finder.png, \ Windows\Start menu\file explorer.lnk
 Maps: rl_maps.png, \Program Files\GoogleMaps\GoogleMaps.exe
 Weather: blank.png, \Program Files\Weather Watcher\WeatherWatcher.exe
 Calculator: rl_cal.png, \ Windows\Start menu\calculator.lnk
 Notes: rl_notes.png, \ Windows\Start menu\programs\notes.lnk
 Settings: rl_settings.png, \Windows\CommManager.exe (that's a personal preference)
 Phone: blank.png, \Program Files\Contact Manager (Pocket CM)\pocketCM.exe
 Mail: rl_mail.png, \ Windows\Start menu\programs\messaging.lnk
 Web: rl_navi.png, \ Windows\Start menu\programs\Internet explorer.lnk
 Media: rl_ipod.png, \Program Files\TCPMP\player.exe

3. Wisbar Advance
1. The cab is located in: skin1.4\Skin\Wisbar Advance 2\WisbarAdvance2.cab
2. Drag the Cab into the "My Documents" folder on your phone using sync software
3. Navigate to the cab on your phone and install it onto your phone by clicking on it
4. Copy the included theme from: skin1.4\Skin\Wisbar Advance 2\iPhone to: the Wisbar themes folder in Program files\Lakeridge\Wisbar Advance \themes
5. Go to Start>Programs>Wisbar Advance and open up the settings. Apply the theme and exit out of the settings manager.
4. VJ Toggle - make the softkeys vanish!
1. The cab is located in: skin1.4\Skin\VJToggleToday\VJToggleToday.cab
2. Drag the Cab into the "My Documents" folder on your phone using sync software
3. Navigate to the cab on your phone and install it onto your phone by clicking on it
4. Probably need to do a soft reset to see results
5. Installing the Dialer:
1. The cab is located in: skin1.4\Skin\Dialpad\iphone.cab
2. Drag the Cab into the "My Documents" folder on your phone using sync software
3. Navigate to the cab on your phone and install it onto your phone by clicking on it
4. You must restart your device to complete the installation. Hit ok
Finally, we're almost done!

Do a soft reset. You will notice that the bottom of the screen has what I like to call a "dead space." To eliminate this eye sore do a search in your windows directory for ".gif" Search through the results until you find a file named something like: "tdywater.gif" (mine was called "tdywater_240_320.gif"). If necessary rename the included "tdywater.gif" file to whatever your search yielded. Drag the included file onto your pocket pc to replace the existing one. Do a soft reset.
Once you have done a soft reset, your phone should now display the skin appropriately.
If not, post your problems her and once again, I will do my best to help. Hope all goes well….Good Luck.

entry.title:
I MIGHT have a fix for this...

This problem...
entry.content:
I MIGHT have a fix for this...

This problem has annoyed thousands of people on hundreds of forums (and FF programmers refuses to get rid of it). I think I found a solution, so please help me spread the word if it works for you:

1) type about:config in the address bar

2) search for accessibility.typeaheadfind and set it to false. Also set the autostart to false.

3) Try your darndest to make it happen again with all of your tried and true methods and if it doesn't then this may well be the fix we've all been looking for.

This problem only seems to happen randomly for me, so I can't test it very well myself...

entry.title: It's not a good idea to replace /usr/bin/python wi...
entry.content:
It's not a good idea to replace /usr/bin/python with a different version. Various things (installer scripts from Apple, scripts from other vendors) assume that they know what version /usr/bin/python is on OS 10.4, you could get nasty surprises if you change it.

That said, you could be fine, because at least you're replacing it with a newer one and not an older one, but in general it's not a safe practice.

entry.title: Uhg I feel so dumb... After playing with this all ...
entry.content:
Uhg I feel so dumb... After playing with this all for over three hours I still don't have everything the way it should be. Ok, so here are my problems:

1. I am missing the bottom three or four (Phone, mail, web, Media) icons (I had them but they disappeared?) I tried editing the skin.xml height from 279...then I tried changing it back to 200. No Luck.

2. SMS Has a skin, but links to nothing...Is this correct?

3. I can't figure out how to get rid of the battery and connection crap at the bottom.

4. Should the text messaging be like the mac one? If so, I haven't gotten it to change at all.

5. I never could figure out how to install the phm editor. Where can I find the cab? This is the least of my concerns, as I can edit the clock myself. However, if everything else was working I wouldn't mind if this would too.

All in all, I am very happy with these improvements to the phone. They definitely make this phone a better device.
Anyone know how I can start all over again with my phone back to normal and try to redo all of this now that I am a bit better at understanding the instructions?
Thanks so much for all your help Jenny!
Cheers,
Philip

entry.title: On Mogul 6800, I found that when I installed VJ To...
entry.content: On Mogul 6800, I found that when I installed VJ Toggle I was able to use the keyboard to enter one program (eg SMS, or Photos etc). However after each one I lost the keyboard again, but if I exited the Options screen and then re-entered it, I got to do one more. So one at a time I was able to enter all the programs. I also adjusted Skin.xml to move the bottom row up so that the icons show fully. The y settings I used were (in order those over 200 appear) were, 220, 215, 217, 256, 220, 220, 220.

Rocky,

The reason the sms, email, and phone...
entry.content:
Rocky,

The reason the sms, email, and phone numbers don't work is because they are fetched from the registry (which is specific for phones).

You have to go into your registry and find out where those items are counted and then update skin.xml

entry.title:
> -z: this option will compress file
> da...
entry.content:
> -z: this option will compress file
> data and make things a bit faster.

Adding -z will not compress the data between your computer to S3. -z is affective only to remove size is rsync server.

Given that S3 is all or nothing, i.e. if you want to change a file you have to PUT the whole thing again.
Every time a local file has been changed it will uploads the hole new file, not just what has changed. That means that if you are using rsync for doing regular backups you are wasting unnecessary bandwidth.

You can bypass this limitation using 3rd party gateway like: http://www.s3rsync.com/

entry.title: This trick works if your phone allows using MP3's ...
entry.content:
This trick works if your phone allows using MP3's as ringtones, but I think iPhones uses a specific format called *.m4r

Changing the file ending will allow for the "clip" to be used as a ringtone on your iPhone.

Couple of things to watch out for:
1. File format must be MP3
2. Keep in mind that you're transferring a "song" not a ringtone.

alias flushcache='sudo dscacheutil -flushcache'

entry.title: For anyone having trouble removing the scrollbar o...
entry.content:
For anyone having trouble removing the scrollbar on a Daxian device, or indeed any other iClone with a rotatation function - just apply screen rotation to all apps (control panel, settings, system, rotate screen), tip your device to the side and then back up again. Voila, the bar disappears, don't ask me why - seems the screen re-draws to the correct resolution (this is easier than messing about with icon placements).

Now if anyone can tell me how to persuade rlToday to read the voicemail count as a Binary number instead of Hex so I wouldn't see 429... I'd be very grateful...

entry.title: This is a great post about rsync and what it's cap...
entry.content:
This is a great post about rsync and what it's capable of, but there's a key point you should note...

The disk failures you describe at the beginning of your article should not be attributed to Apple build quality. Apple buys internal hard drives from third party manufacturers like Seagate and Samsung. When those drives fail, it's more a reflection on drive manufacturer than the computer builder/assembler.

Otherwise, great post!

entry.title: Ok here is the deal, I forgot my administrator pas...
entry.content:
Ok here is the deal, I forgot my administrator password, I had the install disk, I read somewhere in the forums that I could boot off the install disk holding C down and going to utilities to change my password. I did that, but once by computer restarted it would not go to my desktop it would ask me to log in. And apparently my new password was not working, and was unable to boot of the install disk again. I went to another mac forum where I found the following code wich would work by pressing command s:

/sbin/fsck -y [Enter]
/sbin/mount -uaw [Enter]
rm /var/db/.applesetupdone [Enter]
reboot [Enter]

This code was suppose to allow me to change the admin password without booting from the install disk, unfortunately the only thing it did was bring me to a new user registration thing that would block itself out after the name,address and the questions about “where and what” the computer will be used for. I am really frustrated. I need some help please! I at least want to be able to boot it of the install disk again. Holding C, or Shift, or alt+command+p+r is not working. Please help! It wont ask me for my password anymore no matter what I do it keeps taking me to the new user registration.

entry.title: You can actually make wget look like any browser y...
entry.content:
You can actually make wget look like any browser you want (as far as the hosting server is concerned). For example, to make it look like Firefox running on windows you could call it like this:

wget --user-agent="Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; es-ES; rv:1.8.0.6) Gecko/20060728 Firefox/1.5.0.6"

entry.title: Great Job! I was looking for such add-on for years...

Great Job! I was looking for such add-on for years! I'd like to tell you that it is working fine on firefox 3.0.2, but it was some adjustments in the install.rdf file (maxversion value = 3.0.*).
Some Small issues:
1) If the gmail is set to rich formating, the message body field does not trigger the function. It is required to change the message to plan text to get it working again.
2) After some new snippets (and reload them), the previous values for workemail and myphone was still there.... ;^)

Thank you very much for this nice add-on

Marco

Hello,

After numerous in single user mode I have been rendered unsuccessful in resetting my password, I am running OS X in an iBook G4 1.2 (early 2004).

Upon logging into single user mode I am prompted by:


Singleuser boot -- fcsk not done
Root device is mounted read-only
If you want to make modifications to files,
run ' /sbin/fsck-y' first and then ' /sbin/mount -uw /'
localhost: / root#

After attempting to run fsck –y, I receiver a message with says:


**/dev/rdisk0s3
**Root file system
**Checking HFS Plus Volume.
Fsck_hfs: Volume is journaled. No checking performed.
Fsck_hfs: Use the –f option to force checking.
localhost: / root#

I then proceed to run:

localhost: / root# /sbin/mount –uw > teturn

and get

root device on (local, read-only, journaled)
devfs on dev (local)
localhost: / root#


I then type in Systemmaster. But I don’t see System started but System complete.

I have also tried:
localhost: / root# passwd username > return (yes I am useig the short username. I did however notice when I type in 'ls /users' it tells me 'Shared username username' 2 usernames does this make a difference?)
localhost: / root# reboot.

The system starts up but I am still locked out?

Please advise. Any pertinent information is greatly appreciated.
Thanks

entry.title: This solution will not work on BJ1 with WM6 as I t...
entry.content:
This solution will not work on BJ1 with WM6 as I tested it.

The only way amot ke it speediest is to place the mp3 files in "MyStuff" (ActiveSync>Explore and place in the folder that opens)then on the BJ you will be able to select MyStuff>MyDocuments and see the files there. Click on one of the mp3 files then select menu>set as>ringtone and you are done

!!! Note: if the mp3 file is >300K you will need to remove the limit by editing the registry key at:
HKEY_Current User > ControlPanel > Sounds>FileSizeLimit and change the value to 999999

I suspect your issue is more related to the last step in the original instructions. Did you replace the tdywater file on your device?

There are 2 files under windowns on the device:
ttywater_240_320.gif and ttywater_320_240.gif.

entry.title:
Nice post!

However, I had my source drive f...
entry.content:
Nice post!

However, I had my source drive fail on Linux, which made the mount point empty (works the same for Mac I think) which in turn made rsync mirror an empty dir.

In a matter of an hour my whole mirror was gone.

Simply mirroring will also mirror any erroneous file deletions or changes made on the source drive.

In order to prevent this I added the following switches --backup, --backup-dir, and --suffix

--backup makes rsync make a backup of any file that it changes or deletes from the mirror.

--backup-dir tells rsync where to put the backup (I use --backup-dir=$BACKUP_DIR/`date +%Y/%m` -- which gives me a dir per year and month in my "$BACKUP_DIR")

--suffix adds a suffix to backed up files. You can either go with ".bak" to make rsync do one backup and remove older backups, however since I might not always note at once what I removed or what got broken I use --suffix=.`date +%Y-%m-%d` making the backup into YYYY-MM-DD making a backup for each day (for all changed files).

Note: If you set up your system like this you need to keep a keen eye on your S3 account or it will grow and cost more each month -- cleaning out old backups is a recommendation. Most of my settings (the ones involving dates) will only work for Linux (but I think Mac OS X will make it too... windows most certainly won't). If you run windows you can simply use "--backup-dir=/jungledisk/backup" (or wherever you have your jungledisk mounted) and "--suffix=.bak" in which way you'll be a bit safer than just blindly mirroring whatever has happened to your source drive.

This page has a manual entry for rsync http://www.ss64.com/bash/rsync.html. If you have a Linux (or Mac?) box you could do "man rsync" in a terminal window. Reading up on switches is a great way to fine tune your script!

entry.title: I found this on another blog - useful - I bought a...
entry.content:
I found this on another blog - useful -
I bought a dead laptop off fleabay, got it working, was locked out, used this command set and was in as a new user.

Two things:- being 'legit' I had no problem registering with Apple!

The other was a wake up call, I could now access all the previous owners 'stuff' (documents, pictures, music etc.) on the HD. (I couldn't figure why there was so much space used on the HD!)
SELLER BEWARE wipe or remove or trash your hard drive BEFORE selling your dead laptop !!
This feller was fortunate that all I did was trash his stuff, to get the space back on the HD.
I wonder how many 'dead' laptops are bought for the information that could be obtained?!

entry.title:
This is the only code that works reliably
/sbin/f...
entry.content:
This is the only code that works reliably

/sbin/fsck -y [Enter]
/sbin/mount -uaw [Enter]
rm /var/db/.applesetupdone [Enter]
reboot [Enter]

But remember you are registering (i assume) 'your' computor with Apple.... which will include your IP & mac ( not apple) address

entry.title: Search engine rankings are never really all that s...
entry.content:
Search engine rankings are never really all that surprising. Google is always first, Yahoo! is definitely second and Bing comes in third every month, without fail. Sometimes Yahoo! or Bing will rise or fall just a little bit and one will have the benefit of the other's loss, however it's never an enormous drop.

January's rankings were also on the same lines. Google came first, Yahoo! came second and Microsoft came third, experiencing a small gain over the previous month. However, in a most unusual turn of events Microsoft gained at the expense of Google for the first time.


According to ComScore (via CNet), Google's dominant share of the search market slipped by 0.3 percentage points to 65.4 percent of all searches conducted in the U.S. As a result, Bing increased by 0.6 percentage points to 11.3 percent of all searches. Yahoo! lost another 0.3 percent, dropping to 17 percent of all searches.

Microsoft Bing has experienced almost consistent growth since it launched last May, rising from 8.4 percent in June to its current 11.3 percent. Bill Gates once told the press that the search engine created by microsoft is the best product till date created by Microsoft. Hope that turns out true. People are already fascinated by the interface provided by Bing. [url=http://technoages.com/articles/bing-is-eating-googles-share-of-search-engine-traffic/]Let us wait and see if Bing can sustain its growth[/url]

entry.title: Works fabulously. One comment for those who are a...
entry.content: Works fabulously. One comment for those who are afraid of losing the information in their "old" admin accounts: you can use the new admin login to reset the password for your original admin login (System Preferences --> Users). Then, log out of the new one, log into the old one, and delete the new account. Then you're back to your original admin account, with all the permissions/info/documents that go along with it, but with a new password!

entry.title: I just completed this but now my computer will not...
entry.content:
I just completed this but now my computer will not boot up! I do I reverse it?

Wednesday, July 11, 2007
Reset OS X Password Without an OS X CD
So you and your friends have a wild party and you wake up in the morning to realize someone has changed the admin password on your beloved mac and you can no longer access your computer. No problem, you can just pop in the OS X DVD that came with your computer and reset the password....but wait, that's missing too.

Here's how to reset your OS X password without an OS X CD. You need to enter terminal and create a new admin account:

1.Reboot

2.Hold apple + s down after you hear the chime.

3.When you get text prompt enter in these terminal commands to create a brand new admin account (hitting return after each line):

◦mount -uw /
◦rm /var/db/.AppleSetupDone
◦shutdown -h now

4.After rebooting you should have a brand new admin account. When you login as the new admin you can simply delete the old one and you're good to go again!
